alert.note: Alert for Graham (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 3:25PM MST until August 22 at 5:15PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following county, southwest Graham. * WHEN...Until 630 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 325 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms in and around Franklin, southwest and west of Mt Graham. This will cause small stream flooding. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Ash Creek, W A Wash, Gillespie Wash, Oak Creek, Owl Wash, High Creek, Oak Draw, Aravaipa Creek, Willow Spring Wash, Stockton Wash, Twilight Creek and Dial Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bonita and Fort Grant. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
